CHAPTER XXII.

OF CRUCIBLES FOR MELTING GOLD AND SILVER.

HAleG all these things ready to your hands, take white clay and grind it very fine, and old vases, in which gold or silvei· has been before melted ; being taken, break them up separately. If you have not these, take baked fragments of white earthen pots, and put them in the fire until they glow, and if they do not crack allow them to cool and grind them apart. Then put two parts of the ground clay and a fourth¹ part of the burnt pot fragments, and mix it with warm water, beat it strongly, and make crucibles large and small of it, in which you can melt gold and silver. And in the mean time, while they are drying, taking the balance, weigh the gold or silver which you wish to be worked. But if the silver be not pure, purify it in this manner.
